tooltip.desc: It is possible to display the automatic tooltip that effects generate without actually executing the effects.

^event_target:.*$.todo: Somehow determine which type of scope this is...

add_core.description: Add core to specific province id

add_claim.description: Add core to specific province id

add_permanent_claim.description: The defined scope gains a permanent claim on the specified province.

set_capital.description: Set the capital of the current scope country.

free_vassal.description: Free a vassal X of the current country scope.

set_religious_school.description: Set religious school for the current country scope

group.description: The religion group the school belongs to.

swap_non_generic_missions.description: The mission series potential triggers can be re-checked by using swap_non_generic_missions = yes, which will re-evaluate the triggers and swap series to match the country's current state.

add_absolutism.description:
Adds absolutism to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if Absolutism isn't active.

add_accepted_culture.description:
Adds a new accepted culture to the current scope.
Notes: Cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cultures/*.txt.
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

add_active_policy.description:
Adds a policy for the current scope.
Notes: Policies are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/policies/*.txt.
Won't work if the policy triggers are not met by the country, or there are no free policy slots.

add_adm_power.description: Adds Administrative power to the current scope.

add_adm_tech.description:
Adds ADM technologies to the current scope.
Notes: You cannot remove technologies.

add_army_professionalism.description: Adds Army Professionalism to the current scope.

add_army_tradition.description: Adds Army Tradition to the current scope.

add_authority.description:
Adds authority to the current scope. Used in Religious Reforms that use authority.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using authority.

add_church_aspect.description:
Adds the defined aspect to the current scope.
Notes: Church Aspects are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/church_aspects/00_church_aspects.txt.
No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_church_power and the aspect set in aspects.
Does not work with Blessings.

add_church_power.description:
Adds Church Power to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_church_power.

add_corruption.description: Adds corruption to the current scope.

add_devotion.description:
Adds devotion to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government using has_devotion.

add_dip_power.description: Adds Diplomatic power to the current scope.

add_dip_tech.description:
Adds DIP technologies to the current scope.
Notes: You cannot remove technologies.

add_doom.description:
Adds doom to the current scope. Used in Religious Reforms that use doom.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using doom.

add_faction.description:
Adds a faction to the current scope.
Notes: Factions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/factions/.

add_fervor.description:
Adds Fervor to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using fervor.

add_harmonization_progress.description:
Adds Harmonization Progress for the current harmonization target to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_harmony.

add_harmonized_religion.description:
Adds a religion to the list of Harmonized religions for the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_harmony.

add_harmony.description:
Adds Harmony to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_harmony.

add_heir_claim.description: Adds to the current scope's heir claim.

add_heir_personality.description:
Adds the defined personality to the current heir.
Notes: Ruler personalities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ruler_personalities/00_core.txt

add_heir_support.description: Adds to the local heir's support in an Elective Monarchy.

add_historical_friend.description: Makes the defined scope a historical friend of the current scope.

add_historical_rival.description: Makes the defined scope a historical rival of the current scope.

add_horde_unity.description:
Adds horde unity to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government using nomad.

add_idea.description:
Adds an idea for the current scope.
Notes: Ideas are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ideas/*.txt.
Won't work if the idea isn't present in a National Idea set or a taken Ideagroups set for the country.

add_idea_group.description:
Adds an ideagroup for the current scope.
Notes: Ideagroups are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ideas/*.txt.
Won't work if the country doesn't have any free ideagroup slots.

add_imperial_influence.description:
Adds Imperial Influence for the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not emperor.

add_inflation.description: Adds inflation to the current scope.

add_isolationism.description:
Adds Isolationism to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_isolationism.

add_karma.description:
Adds Karma to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_karma.

add_legitimacy.description:
Adds legitimacy to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government monarchy.

add_liberty_desire.description:
Adds liberty desire to the current scope.
Notes: Used on the subject to raise liberty desire for the overlord.

add_mandate.description:
Adds mandate to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not the emperor of china.

add_manpower.description:
Adds manpower to the current scope.
Notes: 1 is equal to 1000 manpower.

add_mercantilism.description: Adds mercantilism to the current scope.

add_meritocracy.description:
Adds meritocracy to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government using has_meritocracy.

add_mil_power.description: Adds Military power to the current scope.

add_mil_tech.description:
Adds MIL technologies to the current scope.
Notes: You cannot remove technologies.

add_militarised_society.description:
Adds militarisation to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government using militarised_society.

add_navy_tradition.description: Adds Navy Tradition to the current scope.

add_next_institution_embracement.description:
Adds embracement for the current progressing institution within the current scope.
Notes: Institutions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/institutions/*.txt.

add_papal_influence.description:
Adds Papal Influence to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using papacy.

add_patriarch_authority.description:
Adds Patriarch Authority to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using has_patriarchs.

add_piety.description:
Adds Piety to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_piety.

add_prestige.description: Adds prestige to the current scope.

add_queen_personality.description:
Adds the defined personality to the current consort.
Notes: Ruler personalities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ruler_personalities/00_core.txt

add_republican_tradition.description:
Adds republican tradition to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government using republic.

add_ruler_personality.description:
Adds the defined personality to the current ruler.
Notes: Ruler personalities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ruler_personalities/00_core.txt

add_sailors.description:
Adds sailos to the current scope.
Notes: 1 is equal to 1 sailor.

add_scaled_imperial_influence.description:
Adds Imperial Influence for the current scope, scaled by the current Imperial Authority value.
Notes: No effect if not emperor.

add_scaled_republican_tradition.description:
Adds republican tradition to the current scope.
Notes: Scales to the government's election cycle duration.
No effect if not a government using republic.

add_splendor.description:
Adds splendor to the current scope.
Notes: Splendor is used to purchase Age abilities.

add_stability.description: Adds stability to the current scope.

add_tariff_value.description:
Adds tariff value to the current scope.
Notes: Tariff value is the ducats sent to an overlord by subjects such as colonial nations.

add_treasury.description: Adds ducats to the current scope.

add_tribal_allegiance.description:
Adds tribal allegiance to the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government using tribal_federation_mechanic.

add_truce_with.description:
Creates a truce between the defined scope and the current scope.
Notes: The truce length is the default white peace truce length.

add_war_exhaustion.description: Adds war exhaustion to the current scope.

add_yearly_manpower.description:
Adds manpower to the current scope, as a percentage of total yearly manpower.
Notes: 1 is equal to 100% of total yearly manpower.

add_yearly_sailors.description:
Adds sailors to the current scope, as a percentage of total yearly sailors.
Notes: 1 is equal to 100% of total yearly sailors.

add_years_of_income.description:
Adds ducats equal to the years of income defined.
Notes: 1 is equal to 1 year of income, based of a country's current monthly income.

artillery.description:
Spawns an artillery unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Uses the currently selected artillery unit.

break_marriage.description: Breaks the current scope's royal marriage with the defined scope.

break_union.description: Breaks the current scope's union with the defined scope.

cavalry.description:
Spawns a cavalry unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Uses the currently selected cavalry unit.

change_adm.description: Adds ADM skill to the current ruler.

change_consort_regent_to_ruler.description: Makes a consort regent into the current ruler for the current scope.

change_dip.description: Adds DIP skill to the current ruler.

change_government.description:
Changes the government of the current scope.
Notes: Governments are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/governments/*.txt.

change_graphical_culture.description:
Changes the current scope's graphical culture. Graphical culture determines the unit models, advisor portraits, etc that a country uses.
Notes: Graphical cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/graphicalculturetype.txt.

change_heir_adm.description: Adds ADM skill to the current heir.

change_heir_dip.description: Adds DIP skill to the current heir.

change_heir_mil.description: Adds MIL skill to the current heir.

change_mil.description: Adds MIL skill to the current ruler.

change_personal_deity.description:
Changes the current personal deity for the current scope.
Notes: Personal Deities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/personal_deities/*.txt.
No effect if the country does not hold a religion using personal_deity.

change_primary_culture.description:
Changes the primary culture of the current scope.
Notes: Cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cultures/*.txt.
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

change_religion.description:
Changes the religion of the current scope.
Notes: Religions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/religions/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values.
Does not accept TAG scopes.

change_statists_vs_orangists.description:
Changes the Organist-Statist balance.
Notes: Positive moves towards Orangist, negative moves towards Statists.

change_technology_group.description:
Changes the technology group of the current scope.
Notes: Technology Groups are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/technology.txt.
Doesn't change units, use change_unit_type.

change_unit_type.description:
Change the unit type for the current scope.
Notes: The unit types correspond the the technology groups found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/technology.txt.

clear_global_event_target.description: Clears a specific global event target.

clear_saved_name.description:
Clears a saved name key.
Notes: Use this after using the saved name in an effect.

clr_consort_flag.description: Clears a consort flag for the current scope's consort.

clr_country_flag.description: Clears a defined country flag for the current scope.

clr_heir_flag.description: Clears a heir flag for the current scope's heir.

clr_ruler_flag.description: Clears a ruler flag for the current scope's ruler.

collapse_nation.description: Causes owned cores of the current scope to be released as nations and for them to take a percentage of the current scope's owned provinces.

convert_female_heir_to_general.description: Converts a female heir into a general.

convert_female_ruler_to_general.description: Converts a female ruler into a general.

convert_heir_to_general.description: Converts a male heir into a general.

convert_ruler_to_general.description: Converts a male ruler into a general.

create_admiral.description: Generates an new admiral for the current scope.

create_advisor.description:
Adds the defined advisor to the current scope.
Notes: Defaults the advisor's location to the capital, and religion and culture to the current scope's.

create_alliance.description: Creates an alliance between the current scope and the defined scope.

create_conquistador.description: Generates an new conquistador for the current scope.

create_explorer.description: Generates an new explorer for the current scope.

create_general.description: Generates an new general for the current scope.

create_guarantee.description: Creates an guarantee over the defined scope for the current scope.

create_independent_estate.description:
Creates an independent nation from provinces owned by the specified estate within the current scope's owned provinces.
Notes: Estates are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/estates/*.txt
The additional parameters for the independent nation are found within an estate's file.

create_independent_estate_from_religion.description:
Creates an independent nation from provinces owned by the specified estate within the current scope's owned provinces.
Notes: Estates are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/estates/*.txt
Created with the religion that the majority of the provinces that the defined estate own holds.
The additional parameters for the independent nation are found within an estate's file.

create_march.description:
Makes the defined scope a march subject of the current scope.
Notes: Uses the march subject type.

create_marriage.description: Creates a royal marriage between the current scope and the defined scope.

create_union.description: Makes the defined scope a junior partner in a personal union with the current scope.

create_vassal.description:
Makes the defined scope a vassal subject of the current scope.
Notes: Uses the vassal subject type.

custom_tooltip.description: Displays a localized key in the effect tooltip.

declare_war.description: Creates a no casus belli war against the defined scope for the current scope.

disband_rebels.description:
Disbands all active rebels of the specified type in the provinces of the current scope.
Notes: Rebel types are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/rebel_types/*.txt

dismantle_empire_of_china.description: Removes the Empire of China and the Mandate system.

dismantle_hre.description: Disbands the HRE and removes all members from it.

dissolve_parliament.description:
Disables the Parliament mechanic.
Notes: Only effects governments with has_parliament.

elector.description: Makes the defined scope an elector of the Holy Roman Empire.

enable_religion.description:
Enables an religion that has been restricted with the date parameter.
Notes: Religions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/religions/*.txt

end_disaster.description:
Immediately ends an active disaster for the current scope.
Notes: Disasters are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/disasters/*.txt

excommunicate.description: Excommunicates the defined scope. If already excommunicated, removes excommunication.

exile_heir_as.description: Removes the current heir of the current scope, saving them to the unique string.

exile_ruler_as.description: Removes the current ruler of the current scope, saving them to the unique string.

force_converted.description: Sets whether the current scope has been force converted.

form_coalition_against.description: The current scope creates or joins a coalition against the defined scope.

galley.description:
Spawns a galley unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Uses the current scope's current galley unit.
Requires the province scope to have a port.

grant_independence.description: The current scope is granted independence from their overlord.

heavy_ship.description:
Spawns a heavy ship unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Uses the current scope's current heavy ship unit.
Requires the province scope to have a port.

hide_ambient_object.description: Hides a visible ambient object from the map/ambient_objects.txt file.

hre_inheritable.description: Makes the seat of the Emperor inheritable.

imperial_ban_allowed.description: Enables the Imperial Ban casus belli.

infantry.description:
Spawns a infantry unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Uses the currently selected infantry unit.

inherit.description: The current scope inherits all of the defined scope's provinces.

internal_hre_cb.description: Disables casus belli creation for HRE members against one another.

join_league.description: Makes the current scope join the League that the defined scope belongs to.

kill_advisor.description:
Kills a hired advisor for the current scope.
Notes: Advisor types are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/advisortypes/*.txt
Displays the advisor death message box when used.
Only works for advisors that have been hired.

kill_heir.description:
Kills the heir of the current scope.
Notes: Displays heir death message.

kill_ruler.description: Kills the ruler of the current scope.

leave_league.description: Makes the current scope leave the League that the defined scope belongs to.

light_ship.description:
Spawns a light ship unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Uses the current scope's current light ship unit.
Requires the province scope to have a port.

loan_size.description:
Changes the loan size of the current scope.
Notes: Size is the number of months in monthly income that a single loan is equal to.

log.description:
Displays a string in the game.log when executed.
Notes: Accepts all localization commands (i.e. [Root.GetName], etc)

mercenary_cavalry.description:
Spawns a mercenary cavalry unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Uses the currently selected cavalry unit.

mercenary_infantry.description:
Spawns a mercenary infantry unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Uses the currently selected mercenary infantry unit.

reinstate_parliament.description:
Re-enables the Parliament mechanic after dissolve_parliament.
Notes: Only effects governments with has_parliament.

release.description: The current scope releases all provinces with the defined scope's cores.

release_all_subjects.description: The current scope releases all possible subjects from cores.

remove_accepted_culture.description:
Removes an accepted culture from the current scope.
Notes: Cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cultures/*.txt.
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

remove_advisor.description:
Removes a hired advisor for the current scope.
Notes: Advisor types are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/advisortypes/*.txt
Does not display the advisor death message box when used.
Only works for advisors that have been hired.
remove_advisor.todo: Figure out if this one can also accept advisortypes / monarch power type, like remove_advisor_by_category

remove_advisor_by_category.description:
Removes a hired advisor of a monarch power type, or advisor type for the current scope.
Notes: Only works for advisors that have been hired.

remove_church_aspect.description:
Removes the defined aspect from the current scope.
Notes: Church Aspects are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/church_aspects/00_church_aspects.txt.
No effect if the country does not have the aspect.
Does not work with Blessings.

remove_consort.description: Removes the current consort for the current scope.

remove_country_modifier.description: Removes an already assigned country modifier from the current scope.

remove_faction.description:
Removes a faction from the current scope.
Notes: Factions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/factions/.

remove_fow.description: Removes the fog of war in the current scope for the previous scope.

remove_heir.description:
Removes the heir of the current scope.
Notes: Does not display the heir death message.

remove_heir_personality.description:
Removes the defined personality from the current heir.
Notes: Ruler personalities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ruler_personalities/00_core.txt

remove_historical_friend.description: Removes the historical friendship between the defined scope and the current scope.

remove_historical_rival.description: Removes the historical rivalry between the defined scope and the current scope.

remove_idea.description:
Removes an idea for the current scope.
Notes: Ideas are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ideas/*.txt.
Won't work if the idea isn't held.

remove_idea_group.description:
Removes an ideagroup for the current scope.
Notes: Ideagroups are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ideas/*.txt.
Won't work if the ideagroup isn't held.

remove_queen_personality.description:
Removes the defined personality from the current consort.
Notes: Ruler personalities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ruler_personalities/00_core.txt

remove_religious_reforms.description:
Removes taken religious reforms from the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using religious_reforms.

remove_ruler_personality.description:
Removes the defined personality from the current ruler.
Notes: Ruler personalities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ruler_personalities/00_core.txt

revoke_reform.description:
Removes an Imperial Reform.
Notes: Imperial Reforms are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/imperial_reforms/00_hre.txt.

save_event_target_as.description:
Saves the current scope as a key. Is cleared once execution ends (i.e. end of event).
Notes: Use event_target:<key> to access the scope.

save_global_event_target_as.description:
Saves the current scope as a key. Persists after execution until cleared via effect.
Notes: Use event_target:<key> to access the scope.

set_allow_female_emperor.description: Enables female rulers to become emperor.

set_consort_culture.description:
Changes the consort culture for the current scope.
Notes: Cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cultures/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

set_consort_flag.description:
Defines a consort flag for the current scope's consort.
Notes: Flags can be appended with scopes or event targets

set_consort_religion.description:
Changes the consort religion for the current scope.
Notes: Religions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/religions/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

set_country_flag.description:
Defines a country flag for the current scope.
Notes: Flags can be appended with scopes or event targets

set_dynasty.description: Sets the dynasty of the current scope's ruler.

set_emperor_of_china.description: Sets the current Emperor of China.

set_global_flag.description:
Defines a global flag.
Notes: Flags can be appended with scopes or event targets

set_government_rank.description:
Changes the government rank of the current scope.
Notes: Default range is 1 to 3.

set_heir.description: Makes the exiled heir the ruler of the current scope.

set_heir_culture.description:
Changes the heir culture of the current scope.
Notes: Cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cultures/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

set_heir_flag.description:
Defines a heir flag for the current scope's heir.
Notes: Flags can be appended with scopes or event targets

set_heir_religion.description:
Changes the heir religion of the current scope.
Notes: Religions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/religions/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

set_hre_heretic_religion.description: Makes the defined religion the heretic religion of the HRE.

set_hre_religion.description: Makes the defined religion the official religion of the HRE.

set_hre_religion_locked.description: Locks the official and heretic religion assignments, ending the Religious Leagues.

set_hre_religion_treaty.description: Ends the Religious Leagues with no set religions.

set_in_empire.description: Places the current scope and all owned provinces (if valid) in the empire.

set_isolationism.description:
Sets Isolationism for the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_isolationism.

set_karma.description:
Sets the Karma value for the current scope.
Notes: No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_karma.

set_mandate.description:
Sets the mandate value for the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not the emperor of china.

set_meritocracy.description:
Sets the current meritocracy for the current scope.
Notes: No effect if not a government using has_meritocracy.

set_papacy_active.description: Enables or disables the Papacy mechanic.

set_primitive.description:
Toggles Primitive status for the current scope.
Notes: Primitive status controls whether a country has ships and if they can see Primitive-only mechanics, such as Religious Reforms.

set_revolution_target.description:
Makes the defined scope the new revolutionary target.
Notes: Use --- to remove the target and not re-assign.

set_ruler.description: Makes the exiled ruler the ruler of the current scope.

set_ruler_culture.description:
Changes the ruler culture of the current scope.
Notes: Cultures are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cultures/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

set_ruler_flag.description:
Defines a ruler flag for the current scope's ruler.
Notes: Flags can be appended with scopes or event targets

set_ruler_religion.description:
Changes the ruler religion of the current scope.
Notes: Religions are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/religions/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values.

show_ambient_object.description: Displays a hidden ambient object from the map/ambient_objects.txt file.

swap_free_idea_group.description:
Re-evaluates the current scope's national idea set assignment, if they match a different set, they will switch to it.
Notes: Used after tag changes to change Nationa Idea sets.

switch_tag.description: Switches the player view to <scope> tag. Original country becomes controlled by AI.

transport.description:
Spawns a transport unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Uses the current scope's current transport unit.
Requires the province scope to have a port.

unlock_cult.description:
Adds the defined cult to the current scope.
Notes: Cults can be found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/fetishist_cults/*.txt.
No effect if the country does not hold a religion using fetishist_cult.

vassalize.description:
Makes the defined scope a vassal subject of the current scope.
Notes: Uses the vassal subject type.
Exact same effect as create_vassal.

white_peace.description: Forces the defined scope into a white peace truce with the current scope.

add_casus_belli.description:
Adds a casus belli for the current scope against the defined scope.
Notes: Casus belli are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cb_types/*.txt

target.description: The country to add the casus belli against.

months.description: The number of months the casus belli lasts for.

add_country_modifier.description: Adds an event modifier to the current scope as a country modifier.

duration.description: Optional. The number of days to add the country modifier for.

hidden.description: Optional. Whether the country modifier is hidden in the government view.

desc.description: Optional. The string used to override the automatic duration string.

add_disaster_modifier.description:
Applies an event modifier to the current scope that is removed when the disaster is over, or the duration runs out.
Notes: Disasters are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/disasters/*.txt

disaster.description: The disaster to apply the modifier to.

duration.description: The duration for the modifier to be active for.

add_disaster_progress.description:
Adds progress towards an already declared (conditions for disaster are met since at least a month) disaster
Notes: Disasters are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/disasters/*.txt

value.description: The amount of progress to add or subtract.

add_estate_influence_modifier.description:
Adds an influence modifier for the defined estate used by the current scope.
Notes: Estates are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/estates/*.txt

estate.description: The estate to apply the modifier to.

desc.description: The text to display in the Influence tooltip for this modifier.

influence.description: The amount of influence to add or subtract.

duration.description: The duration for which this modifier is active.

add_estate_loyalty.description:
Adds loyalty for the defined estate used by the current scope.
Notes: Estates are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/estates/*.txt

estate.description: The estate to apply the loyalty to.

loyalty.description: The amount of loyalty to add or subtract.

add_estate_loyalty_modifier.description:
Adds an loyalty modifier for the defined estate used by the current scope.
Notes: Estates are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/estates/*.txt

estate.description: The estate to apply the modifier to.

desc.description: The text to display in the Influence tooltip for this modifier.

loyalty.description: The amount of loyalty to add or subtract.

duration.description: The duration for which this modifier is active.

add_faction_influence.description:
Adds influence for the defined faction.
Notes: Mimics the influence boost from pressing the button in the faction window.

faction.description: The faction to add influence to.

influence.description: The amount of influence to add.

add_government_power.description:
Changes the pool size of one of the power pools within a government mechanic.
Notes: List of government mechanics:
russian_mechanic feudal_theocracy_mechanic tribal_federation_mechanic mamluk_mechanic iqta_mechanic

government_mechanic.description: Which government mechanic to add power to.

which.description: Which pool type to add the power to. ADM, DIP or MIL

amount.description: The amount of power to add.

add_incident_variable_value.description:
Changes the value of an Incident for the current scope.
Notes: Incidents are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/isolationism/*.txt
No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_isolationism.

value.description: The amount to add to the incident variable.

add_opinion.description:
Adds an opinion modifier for the current scope held against the defined scope.
Notes: Opinion modifiers are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/opinion_modifiers/*.txt

who.description: The country the opinion modifier is for.

years.description: Optional. Whether the modifier expires after a set amount of years.

add_ruler_modifier.description:
Adds an event modifier to the current scope as a ruler modifier.
Notes: Ruler modifiers are cleared when the ruler dies.

duration.description: Optional. The number of days to add the ruler modifier for.

hidden.description: Optional. Whether the ruler modifier is hidden in the government view.

desc.description: Optional. The string used to override the automatic duration string.

add_spy_network_from.description: Adds spy network in the current scope for the defined scope.

who.description: The country to add spy network for.

value.description: The amount of spy network to add or subtract.

add_spy_network_in.description: Adds spy network for the current scope in the defined scope.

who.description: The country to add spy network in.

value.description: The amount of spy network to add or subtract.

add_trust.description:
Adds trust with the defined scope for the current scope.
Notes: Used in conjuction with the Diplomatic Feedback mechanic from The Cossacks DLC.

who.description: The country trust will be added with.

value.description: The amount of trust to add or subtract.

mutual.description: Optional. Whether to apply the trust change to both countries.

change_price.description:
Changes the price of a trade good globally.
Notes: Tradegood prices are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/prices/*.txt
The new price is the base price + (base price * value)
duration accepts -1 for unlimited duration.

key.description: The localisation key to display in the Trade Good's price tooltip.

value.description: The percentage to change the value by.

duration.description: The duration for the value to stay changed for.

country_event.description:
Fire a country event for the current country scope.
Notes: You cannot fire the same event within itself.

days.description: Optional. The number of days to wait after the effect is executed to fire the event.

random.description: Optional. The max number of additional days that can be added to the daysparameter for randomness.

tooltip.description: Optional. The tooltip to display in the effect tooltip country_event is used in.

create_subject.description:
Makes the defined scope into the defined subject type under the current scope.
Notes: Subject types are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/subject_types/*.txt.

subject.description: The scope to make the subject.

declare_war_with_cb.description:
Declares war for the current scope against the defined scope, using the defined casus belli.
Notes: Casus belli are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cb_types/*.txt

war_goal_province.description: Optional. Defines the province the war was declared for, if required by the casus belli.

define_admiral.description:
Creates an admiral with the defined attributes for the current scope.
Notes: Leader traits can be found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/leader_personalities/*.txt.
Siege improves Blockade Efficiency for admirals.
The name parameter can accept a saved name variable, see set_saved_name for more context.

shock.description: The shock pips of the leader.

fire.description: The fire pips of the leader.

manuever.description: The manuever pips of the leader.

siege.description: The siege pips of the leader.

name.description: Optional. The name of the leader.

trait.description: Optional. A trait automatically assigned to the leader.

define_advisor.description:
Adds the defined advisor to the current scope.
Notes: Advisor types are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/advisortypes/*.txt
Can utilise Event Scope Values for the culture and religionparameters.
The name parameter can accept a saved name variable, see set_saved_name for more context.

skill.description: The amount of skill the advisor has. Limited to 3 maximum.

location.description: Optional. The province that the advisor comes from.

discount.description: Optional. If the SCRIPTED_ADVISOR_DISCOUNT cost reduction applies to this advisor.

culture.description: Optional. The culture of this advisor.

religion.description: Optional. The religion of this advisor.

define_conquistador.description:
Creates a conquistador with the defined attributes for the current scope.
Notes: Leader traits can be found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/leader_personalities/*.txt.
The name parameter can accept a saved name variable, see set_saved_name for more context.

shock.description: The shock pips of the leader.

fire.description: The fire pips of the leader.

manuever.description: The manuever pips of the leader.

siege.description: The siege pips of the leader.

name.description: Optional. The name of the leader.

trait.description: Optional. A trait automatically assigned to the leader.

define_consort.description:
Creates the defined consort for the current scope.
Notes: The skill values are not rolled for consorts, meaning the values set are the exact values a consort gets.
The culture and religion attributes can utilise Event Scope Values.
The name parameter can accept a saved name variable, see set_saved_name for more context.

name.description: Optional. The name of the consort.

country_of_origin.description: Optional. The origin country of the consort.

dynasty.description: Optional. The dynasty of the consort.

age.description: Optional. The age of the consort.

adm.description: Optional. The ADM skill for the consort.

dip.description: Optional. The DIP skill for the consort.

mil.description: Optional. The MIL skill for the consort.

female.description: Optional. Forces the consort to be female.

male.description: Optional. Forces the consort to be male.

culture.description: Optional. The culture of the consort.

religion.description: Optional. The religion of the consort.

define_explorer.description:
Creates an explorer with the defined attributes for the current scope.
Notes: Leader traits can be found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/leader_personalities/*.txt.
Siege improves Blockade Efficiency for explorers.
The name parameter can accept a saved name variable, see set_saved_name for more context.

shock.description: The shock pips of the leader.

fire.description: The fire pips of the leader.

manuever.description: The manuever pips of the leader.

siege.description: The siege pips of the leader.

name.description: Optional. The name of the leader.

trait.description: Optional. A trait automatically assigned to the leader.

define_general.description:
Creates a general with the defined attributes for the current scope.
Notes: Leader traits can be found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/leader_personalities/*.txt.
The name parameter can accept a saved name variable, see set_saved_name for more context.

shock.description: The shock pips of the leader.

fire.description: The fire pips of the leader.

manuever.description: The manuever pips of the leader.

siege.description: The siege pips of the leader.

name.description: Optional. The name of the leader.

trait.description: Optional. A trait automatically assigned to the leader.

define_heir.description:
Creates the defined heir for the current scope.
Notes: The culture and religion attributes can utilise Event Scope Values.
The name parameter can accept a saved name variable, see set_saved_name for more context.

name.description: Optional. The name of the heir.

dynasty.description: Optional. The dynasty of the heir.

age.description: Optional. The age of the heir.

birth_date.description: Optional. The birth date of the heir. Can be used instead of the ageparameter.

claim.description: Optional. The starting legitimacy of the heir.

adm.description: Optional. The minimum ADM skill roll for the heir.

dip.description: Optional. The minimum DIP skill roll for the heir.

mil.description: Optional. The minimum MIL skill roll for the heir.

fixed.description: Optional. Makes the heir skill roll fixed to the defined minimums.

max_random_adm.description: Optional. The maximum ADM skill roll for the heir.

max_random_dip.description: Optional. The maximum DIP skill roll for the heir.

max_random_mil.description: Optional. The maximum MIL skill roll for the heir.

bastardfemale.description: Optional. Forces the heir to be female.

male.description: Optional. Forces the heir to be male.

culture.description: Optional. The culture of the heir.

religion.description: Optional. The religion of the heir.

define_heir_to_general.description: Creates a general from the heir of the current scope.

shock.description: The shock pips of the leader.

fire.description: The fire pips of the leader.

manuever.description: The manuever pips of the leader.

siege.description: The siege pips of the leader.

define_leader_to_ruler.description: Creates a ruler from a leader for the current scope.

type.description: The leader type to pick a leader from.

name.description: The specific leader to use. Used instead of the type parameter.

claim.description: Optional. The starting legitimacy of the ruler.

adm.description: Optional. The minimum ADM skill roll for the ruler.

dip.description: Optional. The minimum DIP skill roll for the ruler.

mil.description: Optional. The minimum MIL skill roll for the ruler.

fixed.description: Optional. Makes the ruler skill roll fixed to the defined minimums.

define_ruler.description:
Creates the defined ruler for the current scope.
Notes: The culture and religion attributes can utilise Event Scope Values.
The name parameter can accept a saved name variable, see set_saved_name for more context.

name.description: Optional. The name of the ruler.

dynasty.description: Optional. The dynasty of the ruler.

age.description: Optional. The age of the ruler.

claim.description: Optional. The starting legitimacy of the ruler.

adm.description: Optional. The minimum ADM skill roll for the ruler.

dip.description: Optional. The minimum DIP skill roll for the ruler.

mil.description: Optional. The minimum MIL skill roll for the ruler.

ADM.description: Optional. The minimum ADM skill roll for the ruler.

DIP.description: Optional. The minimum DIP skill roll for the ruler.

MIL.description: Optional. The minimum MIL skill roll for the ruler.

fixed.description: Optional. Makes the ruler skill roll fixed to the defined minimums.

max_random_adm.description: Optional. The maximum ADM skill roll for the ruler.

max_random_dip.description: Optional. The maximum DIP skill roll for the ruler.

max_random_mil.description: Optional. The maximum MIL skill roll for the ruler.

hide_skills.description: Optional. Hides the skill values for this ruler.

regency.description: Optional. Makes this ruler as a regent.

attach_leader.description: Optional. The name of the leader to generate with the ruler.

female.description: Optional. Forces the ruler to be female.

male.description: Optional. Forces the ruler to be male.

culture.description: Optional. The culture of the ruler.

religion.description: Optional. The religion of the ruler.

define_ruler_to_general.description: Creates a general from the ruler for the current scope.

shock.description: The shock pips of the leader.

fire.description: The fire pips of the leader.

manuever.description: The manuever pips of the leader.

siege.description: The siege pips of the leader.

kill_leader.description:
Kills a leader held by the current scope matching the type used.
Notes: Possible types:general admiral conquistador explorer random <leader name>

type.description: The leader type to kill. name is the specific leader name to target.

remove_casus_belli.description:
Removes a casus belli held against the defined scope for the current scope.
Notes: Casus belli are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cb_types/*.txt

target.description: The country the casus belli is against.

remove_opinion.description:
Removes an opinion modifier for the current scope held against the defined scope.
Notes: Opinion modifiers are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/opinion_modifiers/*.txt

who.description: The country the opinion modifier is held against.

reverse_add_casus_belli.description:
Adds a casus belli against the current scope for the defined scope.
Notes: Casus belli are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cb_types/*.txt

target.description: The country to that gains the casus belli.

months.description: The number of months the casus belli lasts for.

reverse_add_opinion.description:
Adds an opinion modifier for the defined scope held against the current scope.
Notes: Opinion modifiers are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/opinion_modifiers/*.txt

who.description: The country the opinion modifier is added to.

years.description: Optional. Whether the modifier expires after a set amount of years.

reverse_remove_casus_belli.description:
Removes a casus belli held by the defined scope against the current scope.
Notes: Casus belli are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/cb_types/*.txt

target.description: The country that holds the casus belli.

reverse_remove_opinion.description:
Removes an opinion modifier for the defined scope held against the current scope.
Notes: Opinion modifiers are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/opinion_modifiers/*.txt

who.description: The country the opinion modifier holds.

set_ai_attitude.description:
Makes the current scope (if AI) have the defined attitude against the defined scope.
Notes: AI attitudes are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ai_attitudes/00_ai_attitudes.txt.

who.description: Who the attitude is directed against.

locked.description: Whether the attitude can be re-evaluated and changed.

set_ai_personality.description:
Makes the current scope (if AI) the defined personality.
Notes: AI personalities are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/ai_personalities/00_ai_personalities.txt.

locked.description: Whether the personality can be re-evaluated and changed.

set_government_and_rank.description:
Changes the current scope's government and rank at the same time.
Notes: Governments are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/governments/*.txt.
Will respect that governments have fixed ranks and the maximum ranks for subject types.

set_incident_variable_value.description:
Sets the value of an Incident for the current scope.
Notes: Incidents are found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/isolationism/*.txt
No effect if the country does not hold a religion using uses_isolationism.

value.description: The amount to set the incident variable to.

set_saved_name.description:
Saves a name to an unique key for usage in other effects.
Notes: Usable with define_admiral, define_explorer, define_conquistador, define_general, define_ruler, define_consort, define_heir, define_advisor and spawn_rebels.

key.description: The key that holds the name.

type.description: The name generation type. Advisor draws from namelist, simple utilises name parameter.

name.description: The name to hold in the key. Only used with the simple type.

scope.description: The country scope to draw the namelist from. Only used with the advisor type.

set_school_opinion.description:
Changes the current scope's school opinion towards the defined scope's school.
Notes: -1 for negative, 0 for netural and 1 for positive.

who.description: Which country to alter opinion with.

opinion.description: Which opinion state to change to.

units.description:
Spawns a specific unit for the current scope in the defined province scope.
Notes: Units can be found in /Europa Universalis IV/common/units/*.txt.
